did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle:
Bailey-Craddock-Lawson Family Papers,
1837-1915

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Bailey-Craddock-Lawson Family Letters, 1837-1915, n.d. Accession 28301. Personal papers collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Charles O. Willis, Alexandria, Virginia, 29 April 1974.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Yancey Bailey (1755-1804) married Sarah Fowlkes (d. 1833) in 1772 and had nine children, two of whom were John (1795-1871) and Harriet Catherine (1800-1873).

John Bailey married Elizabeth Scott (1797-1884) in 1816 and had two daughters, Frances Madison (1817-1900) and Jane (1819-1899). Frances Madison Bailey married Reuben Charles Traynham (1800-1870) in 1835 and had eight children including, Thomas Benjamin (1836-1910). Jane Bailey married David Lawson (1803-1877) in 1839 and had a daughter, Sallie Fannie (1845-1936). Thomas Benjamin Traynham and Sallie Fannie Lawson married in 1869 and had a son, David Lawson (1869-1930), among other children.

Harriet Catherine Bailey married Thomas Easley (1780-1835) in 1814 and had nine children: Sarah Ann (1815-1821), Robert (1819-1819), Thomas, Jr. (1823-1847), Mittie, Harriet Amanda (b. 1825), Fannie Yancey (1827-1885), Charles Bruce (1832-1889), William Henry (1833-1861), and Mary Bailey (1834-1928). Thomas Easley Jr. graduated from West Point in 1846 and was killed at the Battle of Churubusco in 1847 during the Mexican War. Harriet Amanda Easley married William Lee Owen. Fannie Yancey Easley married Dr. Charles James Fox Craddock (1819-1865) in 1852. William Henry Easley served as Captain of the Black Walnut Dragoons (Company C) of the 3rd Virginia Cavalry, C.S.A. and died of typhoid fever in 1861. Mary Bailey Easley married Dr. John Wimbish Craddock (1824-1884) in 1853.

John A. Wimbish (1756-1818) married Nancy Williams (d. 1836) and had three children: Eliza Jasper (1800-1867), Judith A., and Abraham Wimbish. Judith A. Wimbish married John B. Carrington. Eliza Jasper Wimbish married Dr. Granville Craddock (d. ca. 1829) in 1815 and had four children Sarah Cornelia Wimbish (d. 1881), Charles James Fox, John Wimbish, and Mary Louise Craddock. Sarah Cornelia Wimbish Craddock married 1) Edward Branch and 2) E.M. Jarvis. Dr. Charles James Fox Craddock married Fannie Yancey Easley. Dr. John W. Craddock married Mary Bailey Easley. After the death of her first husband, Eliza J. Wimbish Craddock married Dr. Abram M. Poindexter (1809-1872) and had two more children: Abram Wimbish (1840-1864) and Fannie (ca. 1838-1870). Abram Wimbish Poindexter was killed at the Battle of the Crater in 1864 during the Siege of Petersburg. Fannie Poindexter married Reverend James Taylor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1837-1915, n.d., consisting primarily of letters discussing family news, but also the death of Lt. Thomas H. Easley at the Battle of Churubusco during the Mexican War (#5-6), Mexico City and the effects of disease on the occupying U.S. troops during the Mexican War (#7), the aftermath of the Battle of Big Bethel and the activities of Company C, 3rd Virginia Cavalry in late June 1861 (#12), the seige of Petersburg (#13), geographical descriptions of both Leipzeig and Sonnburg, Germany (#17), and genealogical information about the Trayhan family of Halifax County, Virginia (#23). The majority of the letters are transcribed in Betsy Lawson Willis and Martha Barksdale Craddock, comp., Sketches and Genealogy of the Bailey-Craddock-Lawson Families of Virginia and North Carolina . . . (Alexandria, Virginia: 1974).

did.unittitle: E[liza] J. Poindexter, Poplar Avenue, to Mrs. Edward M. [Sarah] Branch, New Orleans, 28 November 1837
did.abstract: For a typescript of this letter see Betsy Lawson Willis and Martin Barksdale Craddock, comp., Sketches and Genealogy of the Bailey-Craddock-Lawson Families . . . (Alexandria, Virginia: 1974), p. 149-150; hereafter cited as Willis and Craddock.

did.unittitle: Judith A. Carrington, Halifax C. H., to Mrs. Sarah W. Branch, New Orleans, 30 December 1837
did.abstract: For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 150-151.

did.unittitle: R[ebecca] F. W[imbish], Poplar Avenue, to [Mrs. Sarah Wimbish Branch], 30 September 1838
did.abstract: For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 153.

did.unittitle: Eliza J. Poindexter, Poplar Avenue, to Mrs. Sarah W. Jarvis, Houston, Texas, 12 May 1844
did.abstract: For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 156-157.

did.unittitle: D[avid] R[umple] Jones, Adjutant, 2nd Infantry, City of Mexico, to F. Y. Easley, 31 October 1847
did.abstract: Announcing the death of T. H. Easley in the Battle of Churubusco. For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 44.

did.unittitle: George E. Pickett, Mexico, to Mr. W[illia]m L. Owen,1 December 1847
did.abstract: Regarding T. H. Easley's life and death, condolences, personal comments and reminiscences. Added on to Pickett's letter is a letter from D. R. Jones to [William L. Owen], 8 December 1847, regarding transportation of T. H. Easley's remains and personal effects. Negative photostats of this item were previously accessioned as 27891. For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 45-46.

did.unittitle: E. M. Jarvis, Mexico, to Sarah W. Jarvis, Barksdale, Virginia, 13 January 1848
did.abstract: Regarding description of Mexico City and the effects of disease among the American troops. For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 158-159.

did.unittitle: W. H. Easley, Hillsboro, to [Fannie Yancey Easley], 1 October 1848
did.abstract: For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 49-50.

did.unittitle: Fannie [Yancy] E[asley], Charleston, South Carolina, to [Mrs. Harriet C. Easley], 3 July 1850
did.abstract: For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 50-51

did.unittitle: Assignment by the executors of the estate of Thomas Easley to his heirs, 9 January 1854; Memorandum of Agreement on the rights of William H. Easley and Mary B. [Easley] Craddock to their inheritance, 9 January 1854; Receipts of William H. Easley, 11 January 1854, and John W. Craddock, 31 January 1854, for their portions of the estate
John Wimbish, Steamboat Astoria, Mississippi River, to Mrs. Sarah W. Branch, Houston, Texas, 12 November 1838
did.abstract: For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 154-155.

did.unittitle: W. H. Easley, Bethel Church, to Dr. John W. Craddock, Black Walnut, Halifax County, Virginia, 16 June 1861
did.abstract: Describing the aftermath of the Battle of Big Bethel. For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 55.

did.unittitle: [Capt. Abram Wimbish Poindexter], Petersburg, Virginia, to [Rev. and Mrs. Abram and Fannie Poindexter, Halifax County, Virginia], 9 July 1864
did.abstract: Discusses refugees and the conditions and events in the army. For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 161.

did.unittitle: [Mrs. Fannie Poindexter Taylor], Culpeper Court House, to [Mrs. Sarah Wimbish Jarvis, Black Walnut, Virginia], 26 December 1865
did.abstract: For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 160.

did.unittitle: A. M. Poindexter, Richmond, Virginia, to John [Wimbish Craddock], 27 May 1870
did.abstract: For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 162-163.

did.unittitle: R. L. Traynham, Roanoke, Virginia, to Mr. D. L. Traynham, Halifax County, Virginia, 17 December 1884
J. M. Mercer, Sonneburg, Thuringia, Germany, to Mrs. [___] Craddock, 24 January 1886
Sallie F. [Traynham], Harmony, Virginia, to Mr. David L. Traynham, Hyco, Halifax County. Virginia, 7 October 1886
did.physdesc: 4 p., ALS with envelope and two enclosures
did.abstract: Enclosures - two gummed decorative labels on display cards.

did.unittitle: Ruby Traynham, Harmony, Virginia, to Mr. D. L. Traynham, Hyco, Virginia, 27 November 1886 and 3 February 1887
did.physdesc: Two letters, 2 p. each, ALS with envelopes

did.unittitle: Jannie [___], Danville, Virginia, to Mr. D. L. Traynham, South Boston, Virginia, 27 January 1888
Lily C. Cabaniss, Reidsville, North Carolina, to Mrs., J. E. Ragland, Hyco, Halifax County, Virginia, 30 August 1888
"Cousin Jannie", Danville, Virginia, to Mr. D. L. Traynham, South Boston, Virginia, 16 December 1888
James H. Traynham, Laurens, South Carolina, to Mr. Thomas Traynham, Harmony, Virginia, 11 January 1889
did.abstract: Enclosure - business card of Traynham and Dial, Wholesale and Retail Dealers.

did.unittitle: J. R. Guthrie, Clover Depot, to Mr. David L. Traynham, South Boston, Virginia, 7 June 1893
did.physdesc: 2 p., ALS with 1 p. printed for filled out by hand
did.abstract: With enclosure receipt for taxes on land of Mrs. Rebecca Traynham, Halifax County, Virginia.

did.unittitle: Mamie [___], Gibson's Station, North Carolina, to David [___], 9 June 1893
Warner Moore and Co., The Dunlop Mills, Richmond, Virginia, to R. W. Lawson and Co., South Boston, Virginia, 31 May 1894
J. Bailey Owen, Henderson, North Carolina, to Mrs. Mary B. Craddock, Cluster Springs, Virginia, 6 July 1915
did.abstract: For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 48.

did.unittitle: [___], to Dr. Craddock, n.d.
F[annie] Y. Craddock, to (Mary Bailey Easley Craddock?), n.d.
did.abstract: For a typescript of this letter see Willis and Craddock, p. 165.
